question: Where did the British India Society (1839) founded by William Adams?
explanation: The British India Society (1839): Founded in London with the efforts of William Adam, one of the friends of Raja Ram Mohan Roy. He along with George Thompson, William Ednis, and Major General Briggs organised meetings and enlightened people about the miserable conditions in India. In this series, they started a newspaper \"British Indian Advocate\" to put light on it.
